items.reasoning: Both Johannine texts open with 'In the beginning' and 'Word' (logos) terminology. This is literary_parallel due to shared Johannine vocabulary and structure. Both affirm Christ's pre-existence and deity, making christological_parallel appropriate as secondary. Much stronger than generic thematic_echo.

1 John's 'life was revealed' connects to John's 'In him was life.' Both use distinctive Johannine 'life' (zoe) vocabulary in prologue contexts. Literary_parallel captures the shared Johannine literary tradition better than thematic_echo.

1 John's 'we have heard, seen, touched' directly parallels John's 'Word became flesh and dwelt among us.' Both emphasize incarnation with eyewitness testimony language. Literary_parallel for shared Johannine eyewitness vocabulary, christological_parallel for incarnation theology.

4:14's 'we have seen and testify' elaborates 1:1's initial witness statement. Both affirm Christ as Savior, so christological_parallel is more specific than generic theological_principle. Elaboration is correct as primary.

1 John 1:2's 'eternal life, which was with the Father and was revealed to us' closely mirrors John's prologue vocabulary and structure. Literary_parallel for Johannine corpus connection, christological_parallel for deity affirmations.

Both passages emphasize eyewitness testimony using distinctive Johannine 'testify/witness' (martyreo) vocabulary. Literary_parallel captures shared Johannine witness theme. 1 John elaborates the purpose of testimony.
Both texts share purpose statements about testimony leading to faith/fellowship. Literary_parallel for shared Johannine purpose statement structure. Both teach about believing in Jesus.

5:11's 'God has given us eternal life, and this life is in his Son' elaborates 1:2's 'eternal life revealed.' Christological_parallel better captures Christ as life-giver than generic theological_principle.

5:13's purpose statement 'that you may know you have eternal life' elaborates 1:2's proclamation of eternal life. Covenant_connection for assurance language (knowing we have eternal life) fits better than generic theological_principle.

5:20's 'His Son Jesus Christ. He is the true God and eternal life' elaborates 1:2's eternal life theme. Christological_parallel for explicit deity affirmation (calling Jesus 'true God') is very specific.
Both passages share 'that your joy may be complete/full' using identical Johannine joy vocabulary. Literary_parallel for shared formula. Covenant_connection for joy as fruit of abiding relationship.
Both use 'that your joy may be complete' formula. Literary_parallel for Johannine joy language. Covenant_connection for joy resulting from answered prayer/fellowship.

1 John's 'God is light' and John's 'true light' share distinctive Johannine light/darkness dualism. Literary_parallel for shared vocabulary. Christological_parallel since John identifies Christ as the light.

1 John's 'God is light, no darkness in him' parallels John 8:12 'I am the light of the world.' Literary_parallel for Johannine light metaphor. Christological_parallel for Jesus claiming divine light attribute.
Both describe God with light imagery. Theological_principle (divine attributes) is appropriate. Shared_metaphor (light) is more specific than allusion since both explicitly use light imagery.

Both passages contrast walking in light vs. darkness using Johannine dualism vocabulary. Literary_parallel for shared Johannine light/darkness language. Contrast for the explicit opposition between light and darkness.
Both explicitly contrast light and darkness as incompatible. Contrast is primary since Paul asks 'what fellowship has light with darkness?' Shared_metaphor for light/darkness imagery.
Both teach about Christ's blood cleansing from sin. Theological_principle is appropriate. Ritual_practice as secondary since Hebrews explicitly connects to sacrificial system.
1 John's 'cleanse us from all unrighteousness' parallels Hebrews' cleansing language. Theological_principle with ritual_practice secondary (sacrificial cleansing imagery).
5:10 elaborates on calling God a liar theme from 1:10. Contrast as secondary for the opposition between believing and calling God a liar.
Both present Christ as mediator/advocate between God and humanity. Christological_parallel for Christ's mediatorial role is more specific than generic theological_principle.
1 John's 'advocate with the Father' parallels Hebrews' 'lives to intercede.' Christological_parallel for Christ's ongoing intercessory role.
Both describe Christ's heavenly ministry. Christological_parallel for Christ's priestly work. Ritual_practice secondary for temple/sacrifice imagery in Hebrews.

1 John's 'atoning sacrifice' (hilasmos) and John's 'Lamb of God who takes away the sin' share Johannine sacrificial vocabulary. Literary_parallel with christological_parallel for Christ as sin-bearer.
Both use propitiation/atoning sacrifice (hilasmos/hilasterion) terminology. Christological_parallel for Christ as propitiation. Ritual_practice for atonement imagery.
Both describe Christ making propitiation/atonement for sins. Christological_parallel for Christ's priestly work. Ritual_practice for sacrificial system.
4:10 elaborates 2:2's atoning sacrifice theme, adding God's love as motivation. Christological_parallel for Christ as atoning sacrifice.
Both link keeping commands with knowing/loving God using Johannine obedience vocabulary. Literary_parallel for shared formula. Covenant_connection for obedience as covenant faithfulness.
Both connect word-keeping with divine indwelling. Literary_parallel for Johannine obedience language. Covenant_connection for abiding relationship.
Both instruct about following Christ's example. Parallel_instruction for similar commands about imitating Christ. Christological_parallel for Christ as model.
Both use 'walk as he walked' / 'I have set you an example' language in Johannine contexts. Literary_parallel for shared Johannine example/imitation vocabulary. Parallel_instruction secondary.
Both command following Christ's example/steps. Parallel_instruction for similar commands. Christological_parallel for Christ as exemplar.
1 John's 'old/new command' directly references John's 'new command to love one another.' Literary_parallel for Johannine love command language. Parallel_instruction for the command itself.
Both Johannine epistles discuss the love command using similar vocabulary. Literary_parallel for Johannine corpus. Parallel_instruction for command to love.
Both describe light coming/shining using Johannine light vocabulary. Literary_parallel with contrast for darkness passing away vs. light coming.
1 John's 'new command' directly references John 13:34's new commandment. Literary_parallel for Johannine corpus connection.
Both use night passing/day coming imagery. Shared_metaphor for darkness/light imagery. Contrast for old vs. new era.
Both contrast former darkness with present light. Contrast primary for 'once darkness, now light.' Shared_metaphor for light/darkness imagery.
Both contrast children of light vs. darkness. Contrast for light/darkness opposition. Shared_metaphor for imagery.
Both address stumbling block issue. Parallel_instruction for similar ethical guidance. Shared_metaphor for stumbling imagery.
Both use 'walking in darkness' with blindness imagery in Johannine contexts. Literary_parallel for shared Johannine vocabulary. Shared_metaphor for darkness/blindness.
Both use spiritual blindness metaphor. Shared_metaphor for blindness imagery. Theological_principle for spiritual blindness doctrine.
Both use blindness/sight metaphor for spiritual condition. Shared_metaphor primary.
2:11 elaborates 2:9's darkness/hatred theme with blindness imagery. Contrast for light/darkness opposition.
Both connect hatred with spiritual death/darkness. Elaboration for developing hatred theme. Contrast for love/hate opposition.
Both speak of forgiveness/washing in Christ's name. Theological_principle with covenant_connection for new covenant forgiveness.
1 John's 'him who was from the beginning' parallels John's prologue. Literary_parallel for Johannine 'beginning' vocabulary. Christological_parallel for Christ's eternality.
1 John's 'overcome the evil one' parallels John's 'I have overcome the world.' Literary_parallel for Johannine victory language. Christological_parallel for Christ's victory enabling ours.
2:13 elaborates 1:1's 'from the beginning' theme. Christological_parallel for Christ as eternal one.
4:4's 'overcome them' elaborates 2:13's overcoming theme. Christological_parallel for victory through Christ.
5:18's protection from evil one elaborates 2:13's overcoming. Christological_parallel for Christ's protective power.
Repeated 'from the beginning' language. Literary_parallel for Johannine terminology.
Both command being strong (1 John 'you are strong', Eph 'be strong'). Parallel_instruction for similar commands. Shared_metaphor for spiritual strength.
Elaborates 'from the beginning' theme.
Word abiding/remaining in believers connects to earlier word themes. Covenant_connection for indwelling word.
Both command not conforming to world. Parallel_instruction for similar commands. Contrast for world vs. God.
Both explicitly contrast friendship with world vs. God. Contrast primary for explicit opposition. Parallel_instruction for warning.
Both address lusts/desires. Parallel_instruction for similar ethical commands. Contrast for flesh vs. Spirit.
Both describe sinful nature. Theological_principle for doctrine of sin. Contrast for former vs. present state.
Both emphasize doing God's will. Parallel_instruction for similar emphasis. Contrast for profession vs. obedience.
Both contrast passing world with eternal. Contrast primary for temporal vs. eternal. Theological_principle for eschatology.
Both warn about false Christs/antichrists. Theological_principle for eschatology. Allusion to Jesus' warning.
Both address departures revealing authenticity. Theological_principle for perseverance doctrine. Contrast for true vs. false.
4:3 elaborates 2:22's antichrist definition. Christological_parallel for denying Christ's deity/incarnation.
Both link knowing Father with knowing Son. Literary_parallel for Johannine vocabulary. Christological_parallel for Father-Son unity.
Both define eternal life as knowing God and Christ. Literary_parallel for Johannine knowing vocabulary. Christological_parallel for Father-Son relationship.
4:15 elaborates confession of Son theme. Christological_parallel for confessing Jesus as Son.
5:1 elaborates believing Jesus is the Christ. Christological_parallel for messianic confession.
Both discuss abiding in Father and Son. Elaboration for developing abiding theme. Covenant_connection for mutual indwelling.
Elaborates believing in Son. Christological_parallel for Christ-centered faith.
Both Johannine epistles use abiding/remaining language. Literary_parallel for Johannine corpus. Covenant_connection for abiding doctrine.
Both promise eternal life. Literary_parallel for Johannine eternal life vocabulary. Christological_parallel for life through Christ.
Both promise eternal life through believing in Son. Literary_parallel for Johannine language.
Both define eternal life. Literary_parallel for Johannine eternal life formula.
Both promise Spirit's abiding presence. Literary_parallel for Johannine Spirit/anointing vocabulary. Theological_principle for Holy Spirit doctrine.
Both describe Spirit's teaching ministry. Literary_parallel for Johannine Paraclete teaching.
Spirit guiding into truth. Literary_parallel for Johannine Spirit guidance vocabulary.
Both teach Spirit's instruction. Theological_principle for Spirit doctrine. Contrast for human vs. Spirit teaching.
Both address Christ's appearing. Theological_principle for eschatology. Christological_parallel for Christ's return.
Both address confidence at Christ's coming. Theological_principle for eschatology.
3:2 elaborates what happens when He appears. Christological_parallel for seeing Christ.
Both address confidence before God.
3:7 elaborates righteousness theme. Contrast for righteous vs. unrighteous.
3:10 elaborates distinguishing children of God. Contrast for God's children vs. devil's.
Both discuss being born of God.
Both describe becoming children of God. Literary_parallel for Johannine birth/children vocabulary. Covenant_connection for adoption.
Both address world not knowing God/believers. Literary_parallel for Johannine world-rejection vocabulary. Contrast for world vs. believers.
Both describe Father's love. Literary_parallel for Johannine love vocabulary. Covenant_connection for love relationship.
Both affirm children of God status. Theological_principle for adoption. Covenant_connection for new covenant relationship.
Both teach adoption as children. Theological_principle for election/adoption. Covenant_connection for family relationship.
Both promise seeing Christ's glory. Literary_parallel for Johannine seeing/glory vocabulary.
Both address future revelation of children of God. Theological_principle for glorification.
Both promise being conformed to Christ's image. Theological_principle for glorification. Christological_parallel for Christlikeness.
Both describe transformation into Christ's likeness. Theological_principle for sanctification/glorification.
Both promise transformation to be like Christ. Theological_principle for glorification.
Both address lawlessness. Parallel_instruction for similar teaching about sin. Contrast for righteousness vs. lawlessness.
Both describe Christ taking away sin. Literary_parallel for Johannine sin-removal vocabulary. Christological_parallel for Christ as sinless sin-bearer.
Both affirm Christ's sinlessness. Christological_parallel for Christ without sin. Theological_principle for substitutionary atonement.
Both teach sin shall not have dominion. Theological_principle for sanctification. Covenant_connection for grace vs. law.
3:9 elaborates not sinning theme from 3:6. Theological_principle for doctrine of regeneration.
Both identify devil as original sinner. Literary_parallel for Johannine devil vocabulary. Contrast for devil's children vs. God's.
Both use new birth imagery. Theological_principle for regeneration. Shared_metaphor for birth/seed.
Both describe new birth. Theological_principle for regeneration. Shared_metaphor for birth.
Both distinguish children of God. Literary_parallel for Johannine children vocabulary. Contrast for God's vs. devil's children.
Both present love command. Literary_parallel for Johannine love one another command.
Both command love one another. Literary_parallel for Johannine love command vocabulary.
1 John explicitly cites Cain story. Historical_reference for citing biblical history. Exemplification for using Cain as negative example.
Both address world's hatred. Literary_parallel for Johannine world-hatred vocabulary. Contrast for world vs. believers.
1 John elaborates Jesus' teaching about anger/murder. Parallel_instruction for similar moral teaching. Elaboration for developing murder theme.
Both link devil with murder. Literary_parallel for Johannine murder vocabulary. Contrast for life vs. death.
Both describe Christ's love unto death. Literary_parallel for Johannine love/lay down life vocabulary.
Both teach laying down life for others. Literary_parallel for Johannine 'lay down life' formula.
Both address sacrificial service. Parallel_instruction for similar ethical teaching. Shared_metaphor for being poured out.
1 John alludes to Deuteronomy's open hand to poor. Allusion appropriate. Parallel_instruction for similar command to help needy.
Both teach practical love. Parallel_instruction for similar ethical commands. Wisdom_principle for practical application.
Both command genuine love. Parallel_instruction for similar commands. Contrast for genuine vs. hypocritical.
Both command action not just words. Parallel_instruction for similar ethical teaching. Contrast for words vs. deeds.
Both discuss being 'of the truth.' Literary_parallel for Johannine truth vocabulary.
Both teach confidence before God. Theological_principle for assurance. Covenant_connection for peace with God.
Both teach about answered prayer. Parallel_instruction for prayer teaching.
Both describe pleasing God. Literary_parallel for Johannine pleasing vocabulary. Christological_parallel for Christ's example.
Both promise answered prayer. Literary_parallel for Johannine prayer vocabulary. Covenant_connection for prayer relationship.
Both define God's work as believing in Christ. Literary_parallel for Johannine believe vocabulary.
Both give love command. Literary_parallel for Johannine love one another command.
Both teach Spirit's indwelling. Theological_principle for pneumatology. Covenant_connection for mutual indwelling.
Both command testing. Parallel_instruction for similar commands. Wisdom_principle for discernment.
4:1 elaborates 2:18's false prophets/antichrists. Contrast for true vs. false.
Both affirm incarnation. Literary_parallel for Johannine flesh vocabulary. Christological_parallel for crucial incarnation doctrine.
Both give tests of true confession. Parallel_instruction for confession tests. Christological_parallel for confessing Jesus.
Both Johannine epistles warn about denying incarnation. Literary_parallel for Johannine corpus. Christological_parallel for incarnation.
Both describe overcoming world/ruler. Literary_parallel for Johannine victory vocabulary.
Both encourage with 'God for us' logic. Parallel_instruction for similar encouragement.
Elaborates 'one in you' (Christ/Spirit). Christological_parallel for Christ's power.
Both contrast believers with world. Literary_parallel for Johannine world/not of world vocabulary. Contrast for world vs. believers.
Both say believers not of the world. Literary_parallel for Johannine not-of-world language.
Repeated 'not of the world' formula. Literary_parallel for Johannine language.
Both contrast hearing God's word. Literary_parallel for Johannine hearing/being from God vocabulary. Contrast for from God vs. not from God.
Both describe Spirit of truth. Literary_parallel for Johannine Spirit/truth vocabulary. Contrast for receiving vs. rejecting.
Both claim apostolic authority. Parallel_instruction for recognizing authority. Contrast for knowing vs. not knowing God.
Both contrast true and false spirits. Contrast primary for Spirit of truth vs. error.
Elaborates born of God theme with love.
Elaborates love one another message. Parallel_instruction for repeated love command.
4:9 elaborates God's love revealed. Christological_parallel for sending Son.
Both describe God's love sending Son. Literary_parallel for Johannine God's love/Son vocabulary.
Both describe God's love while we were sinners. Theological_principle for divine love. Christological_parallel for Christ sent/died for us.
Both describe reconciliation while enemies. Theological_principle for reconciliation.
Elaborates atoning sacrifice theme. Christological_parallel for Christ as propitiation.
Both teach reciprocal love/mercy. Parallel_instruction for similar ethical teaching.
Both say 'No one has seen God' in Johannine contexts. Literary_parallel for Johannine formula. Christological_parallel for Christ revealing God.
Both describe God abiding/dwelling. Literary_parallel for Johannine abiding vocabulary.
Both describe God's invisibility. Theological_principle for divine transcendence.
Both teach Spirit's indwelling as assurance. Theological_principle for pneumatology.
Elaborates Spirit witness theme.
Both testify to seeing the incarnate Word. Literary_parallel for Johannine seeing/testimony vocabulary.
Both describe Father sending Son as Savior. Literary_parallel for Johannine sending vocabulary.
Both call Jesus 'Savior of the world.' Literary_parallel for identical Johannine title.
Elaborates Savior of the world. Christological_parallel for Christ's universal saving work.
Both confess Jesus as Son of God. Literary_parallel for Johannine confession vocabulary.
Elaborates confessing Jesus as Son. Christological_parallel for Son of God confession.
Elaborates love perfected/completed. Covenant_connection for mature relationship.
Elaborates confidence before God.
Both contrast fear with sonship. Contrast primary for fear vs. love/sonship. Covenant_connection for adoption.
Elaborates 'liar' theme. Contrast for claim vs. reality.
Elaborates practical love. Wisdom_principle for practical application.
Alludes to love command tradition. Parallel_instruction for love command.
Alludes to greatest commandments. Parallel_instruction for love God and neighbor command.
Both describe being born of God. Literary_parallel for Johannine birth vocabulary.
Both teach new birth doctrine. Literary_parallel for Johannine born again/from above vocabulary.
Both link loving God with Christ. Literary_parallel for Johannine love vocabulary.
Both describe commands as not burdensome. Contrast for heavy vs. light yoke.
Both link love with keeping commands. Literary_parallel for Johannine love/obey vocabulary.
Both teach victory through Christ. Theological_principle for overcoming.
Both reference Jesus' baptism. Literary_parallel for Johannine water witness.
Both discuss truth. Literary_parallel for Johannine truth vocabulary.
Both reference water and blood from Christ. Literary_parallel for Johannine water/blood witness vocabulary.
References Father's testimony at baptism. Historical_reference for citing biblical event.
Both discuss Father's testimony. Literary_parallel for Johannine witness vocabulary.
Both reference two witnesses. Literary_parallel for Johannine testimony vocabulary.
Both contrast believing vs. rejecting God's testimony. Literary_parallel for Johannine witness vocabulary. Contrast for belief vs. unbelief.
Both describe internal witness. Theological_principle for Spirit's testimony.
Both describe Spirit's internal witness. Theological_principle for pneumatology.
Both promise eternal life through Son. Literary_parallel for Johannine eternal life formula.
Both contrast having Son/life vs. not having. Literary_parallel for Johannine has life vocabulary. Contrast for life vs. death.
Both promise eternal life. Literary_parallel for Johannine eternal life vocabulary.
Both present Christ as exclusive way to life. Literary_parallel for Johannine life vocabulary. Christological_parallel for Christ as life.
Both define eternal life through knowing Christ. Literary_parallel for Johannine eternal life formula.
Both Johannine epistles teach having Father and Son. Literary_parallel for Johannine corpus.
Both state purpose: knowing you have eternal life. Literary_parallel for nearly identical Johannine purpose statements. Covenant_connection for assurance.
Both teach about prayer. Parallel_instruction for similar prayer teaching.
Both promise answered prayer. Literary_parallel for Johannine prayer vocabulary.
Both promise answered prayer to those who abide. Literary_parallel for Johannine ask/receive vocabulary.
Alludes to unforgivable sin concept. Allusion appropriate.
Alludes to Jeremiah's command not to pray for certain people. Allusion with parallel_instruction for similar commands.
Similar to Jer 7:16 - command not to pray.
Both address unforgivable sin. Theological_principle for sin unto death doctrine. Allusion to Jesus' teaching.
Both discuss apostasy. Theological_principle for falling away. Contrast for restorable vs. non-restorable.
Both address willful sin after knowledge. Theological_principle for apostasy doctrine.
Contrasts prayer that saves (James) with sin unto death. Contrast primary.
Both promise protection from evil. Literary_parallel for Johannine protection vocabulary. Christological_parallel for Christ's keeping power.
Elaborates overcoming evil one. Christological_parallel for Christ's protective power.
Elaborates not sinning theme. Theological_principle for regeneration doctrine.
Both describe Christ giving understanding. Christological_parallel for Christ's revelatory work.
Both identify Christ as God/with God. Literary_parallel for Johannine high Christology. Christological_parallel for deity affirmation.
Both identify Christ as true life. Literary_parallel for Johannine life vocabulary.
Both define knowing the true God. Literary_parallel for Johannine knowing God vocabulary.
Both call Christ God. Christological_parallel for explicit deity affirmation is very specific. Both are high Christology texts.
Both call Christ 'the true one.' Christological_parallel for Christ's divine truthfulness.
Both command fleeing idolatry. Parallel_instruction for identical command. Contrast for true God vs. idols.
Both contrast turning from idols to God. Contrast primary for idols vs. true God.
